thread.title: Here‚Äôs how Black Twitter ‚Äòcelebrated‚Äô Donald Trump‚Äôs inauguration
thread.title_full: Here‚Äôs how Black Twitter ‚Äòcelebrated‚Äô Donald Trump‚Äôs inauguration

author: Tahirah Hairston
title: Here‚Äôs how Black Twitter ‚Äòcelebrated‚Äô Donald Trump‚Äôs inauguration
text:
‚Äî Mary Pryor (@msmarypryor) January 20, 2017 
At 11 A.M., just as the inauguration was getting underway, Twitter users (organized by @UnitedBlack and @JamilahLemieux ) began live-tweeting The Wiz . Then, at 11:30 AM, other users (organized by @AvaDuvernay and her company @ArrayNow ) watched Malcolm X using the hashtag #ByAnyMeans. Tomorrow at 11AM est, please join us in ignoring the Inauguration and, instead, live-tweeting The Wiz! More to come! #InaugurationBlackout pic.twitter.com/sJGJIFeWjr 
‚Äî JamilahIsoke Lemieux (@JamilahLemieux) January 19, 2017 We are watching @SpikeLee 's MALCOLM X in 3 minutes! Get ready and Tweet along! Use #ByAnyMeans ! pic.twitter.com/rUzM9ohCUB 
The hashtag #ObamaDay was also used to tweet favorite Obama family moments, GIFS, memories and more. It's #ObamaDay , courtesy of @ReignOfApril . Share your favorite Obama memories, photos, gifs and stories! 
‚Äî Thanks Obamas ‚ù§Ô∏è (@HLRJO) January 20, 2017 Great moments in sister history. #ObamaDay pic.twitter.com/BzRbwvfwCo 
‚Äî District 10 Tribute (@Bainst06) January 20, 2017 It's #obamaday so we are posting #BarackObama art by black artists, art by Raggaharts info https://t.co/53MMSiYiji @ReignOfApril üôÇ pic.twitter.com/fo0BYhMEc5
